blogs.title: Understanding JavaScript Closures
blogs.content: JavaScript closures are a powerful feature that allows functions to have access to their outer scope even after the outer function has finished executing. This is particularly useful for data encapsulation and creating private variables.
blogs.author: Jane Doe

blogs.title: A Guide to CSS Flexbox
blogs.content: CSS Flexbox is a layout model that allows you to design complex layouts with ease. It provides a more efficient way to align and distribute space among items in a container, even when their size is unknown or dynamic.
blogs.author: John Smith
